September 23rd 19+5• His Britannic Majesty's Political Agent. re I CINEMA FILMS BAHREIN — me ^|7U22 Confidential. n e . . w » BAHRAIST RECEIPT., ' r ' X_y Ms ./li2 The Company has been experiencing considerable difficulty recently in connection with transportation of Cinema Films to India and is hereby making application for a permanent priority certificate to ensure allocation of air freight space amounting to approximately 120 kilogs per week. Briefly the problem is as followst The Company jointly with The Arabian American Oil Company, hire Cinema Films from various distributors in India* The distributors allow approximately twenty- nine days from the date each film leaves Karachi until its return for transportation and screening time both here in Bahrein and in Saudi Arabia at Dhahran, Ras Tanura and Abqaiq. Whereas every endeavour is made by both the Company and The Arabian American Oil Company to expedite the screening and transporta tion of the films between the four cinemas, we invariably find that the period allotted by the distributors has almost expired, and in some instances has expired, by the time we are able to return the films for despatch by air to Karachi. With the prevailing scarcity of air freight space further delays occur through the inability of The British Overseas Airways Corporation to load the films since they are non-priority freight. The distributors are seriously disturbed by the loss of revenue sustained by them through the frequent late arrival of films in Karachi and we fear that a continuation of these delays might easily result in the cancellation of the contracts. This would mean a serious loss of en tertainment to the detriment of morale and we are anxious to eliminate any waste time which occurs in transportation. We will appreciate your early advice on the above. Yours very truly, CHIEF LOCAL REPRESENTATIVE THE BAHREIN PETROLEUM COMPANY LIMITED3 No. C/926 Political Agency, Bahrain The 26th September, 1945 The Station Manager, British overseas Airways Corporation, Bahrain. titleInfo.title: 'File 10/17 (10/26) Priority air freight for BAPCO cinema films'

physicalDescription.extent: The documents in the file are arranged in chronological order. There is an index at the end of the file (folio 6). The index is arranged chronologically and refers to documents within the file; it gives brief description of the correspondence with a reference number which refers back to that correspondence in the file.
The foliation is written in pencil, in the top right corner. The numbering begins on the front cover with 1, and runs through to 8, on the inside of the back cover of the file.

mods.abstract: The file contains letters between Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited (BAPCO), the Political Agent in Bahrain and the British Overseas Airways Corporation to transport BAPCO's films to India by air.There is an index at the end of the file (folio 6). The reference number 10/26 on the cover is crossed and the file was then renumbered as 10/17.
